item.title: Trees, 6th November
item.description:
Hello I’m not sure what department I need to speak too , Vantage house Badgeworth lane GL514UQ we have slight subsidence issues and require to remove two small trees alongside the property, these trees are on the public footpath - we are happy to remove useing our tree people but will need permission if possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage caused by lorry leaving the road..., 6th November
item.description:
Last week a lorry destroyed our stone garden wall when it left the road and backed into it. The lorry mounted the small kerb and claimed not to have noticed leaving the road. We have lots of pedestrian walkers passing our house daily and if someone had been hit, it would have been a terrible injury. We think that a higher kerb would be a safety measure worth investing in, since the signage at the junction is already in place and didn't help in this accident. We live at Orchard House, Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe GL54 5NQ. Many thanks - Cath Collis cathcollis1969@outlook.com

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gutters require cleaning., 6th November
item.description:
The gutters of Jersey Avenue are full of decomposed leaves with grass and weeds growing out of them. The entire road needs to be swept and cleaned. This is the third report for the same issue, previous attempts have been limited to a small selection of the Avenue, the clean up after the weedkiller application in the summer was never completed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Jersey Avenue, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 6th November
item.description:
Customer has had tree planted in verge o/s property today. Wants it removed as they were never consulted on its placement, and believe it will obstruct visibility when using the driveway, and in the future the roots will cause property damage as the footway and verge are very narrow, so the tree is close to the property.
Report on FixMyStreet
